intro: Agoseris montana, commonly known as mountain agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Agoseris montana is often found in meadows and rocky slopes, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
